advertisement

Local rockers show support for third annual Dare benefit

For the members of the five rock bands and two acoustic acts set to take the stage Wednesday at Crowbar  E PERIOD College Ave. things sure will be different PERIOD

No one will be pocketing a paycheck at the end of the night PERIOD

Each band is just one in a lineup of other talents PERIOD

And a lot of the people in the crowd wont even be there for the music PERIOD

Thats because the third annual Kevin Dare Benefit simply isnt a gig PERIOD Its an event and a bittersweet one at that PERIOD

Dare an accomplished Penn State pole vaulter died tragically while competing at the Big Ten Indoor Track and Field Championships in  PERIOD He was  PERIOD

If you go

What Kevin Dare Benefit Time  p.m PERIOD Date Wednesday Place Crowbar  E PERIOD College Ave PERIOD Details Tickets for the allages show are  in advance and  at the door PERIOD Advance tickets and raffle tickets will be sold before Saturdays Purdue football game in tents near the Beaver Stadium and Bryce Jordan Center entrances PERIOD Tickets are also available at crowbarlivemusic.com and by calling  PERIOD

Michelle Grove a Dare family friend used her connections with local bands to start the benefit two years ago PERIOD Every penny raised goes toward the Kevin Dare Memorial Scholarship Fund PERIOD

 Grove said PERIOD 

A raffle that runs in conjunction with the benefit has prizes including a football signed by Joe Paterno and a jersey signed by Larry Johnson

Between raffle and benefit tickets about  has been raised just this year the threeyear total stands at about  PERIOD

Crowbars doors will open at  p.m. two hours earlier than usual to accommodate acoustic acts Eric Himan and Jared Campbell PERIOD

 Grove said PERIOD

The acoustic acts are a preface to the rock that will transpire as the night goes on and cater to the older folks who want to support the cause but not stay out past their bedtime PERIOD

In the band formerly known as Stept On is slated as the last act of the night PERIOD

Bassist Adam Zimmer who played at the first benefit with Stept On was working for a Web site company when Grove approached him to do a memorial site for Kevin PERIOD

 Zimmer said PERIOD 

Though an ambiance of sadness might be present at the Crowbar Wednesday the benefit is meant to be a positive rockfilled experience PERIOD

 Zimmer said PERIOD 

But when each band dedicates a song to Kevin it might be a little tougher not to break down  for those on stage too PERIOD

 Grove said PERIOD 

Crowbar operations director Dave Wells said he expects a very strong showing which grows each year PERIOD

 Wells said PERIOD 

Zimmer too said he enjoys donating time and support to the Dare family PERIOD Father Ed mother Terri and son Eric he said 

 Zimmer said PERIOD
